creator: karasek@ceskyserver.cz
text:
When you point CustomLog to directory, which doesn't exist, httpd will not start
- it's OK.

An examle is:
CustomLog /some/dir/file

-- Apache can't create file, because there isn't any /some/dir ...

Apache 2.0.49 writes an error mesage. Apache 2.0.50 doesn't.

It's hard to find out, where I have make a mistake, while there isn't any error
mesage :(

If you think, I can help to sovle this problem, please contact me.

Regards
   Antonin Karasek

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
Works for me:

# grep nonesuch conf/httpd.conf
CustomLog /tmp/nonesuch/foo_log common
# bin/apachectl start
# tail logs/error_log
[Mon Jul 12 14:32:58 2004] [error] (2)No such file or directory: could not open
transfer log file /tmp/nonesuch/foo_log.

what behaviour did you see with earlier releases?
